body:
I was looking for a method to abort the `install` routine when an error is detected. I didn't find this described in the manual, and various packages seem to be using various methods:
- `tty.error(...)`
- `raise RunTimeError(...)`
- `raise InstallError(...)`
  I think none of these actually work the way they are intended, although they all do abort the install -- because the respective identifiers are not defined.
title: How to abort an install?
